Gets or sets a value indicating whether the "devenv.exe" check should be bypassed. By default, the also checks whether the current process is "devenv.exe".

member.name: T:Catel.MVVM.IAuthenticationProvider
member.summary: Interface to allow an authentication mechanism to control the CanExecute state of a command.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.IAuthenticationProvider.CanCommandBeExecuted(Catel.MVVM.ICatelCommand,System.Object)
member.summary:
Determines whether the specified can be executed. The class implementing this interface can use any required method to check the command.
It is recommended to use the property to identify a command.
member.returns: true if the specified command can be excecuted; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The CanExecute state of a command is queried a lot. The command itself does not cache any results because it is not aware of role or identity changes. If caching is required, this must be implemented in the class implementing the interface.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.IAuthenticationProvider.HasAccessToUIElement(System.Windows.FrameworkElement,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary:
Determines whether the user has access to the specified . This method is invoked by the Authentication behavior, and can be used to disable or hide UI elements based on a role or any other authentication mechanism.
This method will only be called for UI elements with the Authentication behavior.
member.param: The authentication tag specified by the calling object.
member.returns: true if the user has access to the specified UI element; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Catel.MVVM.ILocator
member.summary: Interface defining shared information about locators. This way, any locator can be casted to this interface and be used to locate something by naming convention.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.ILocator.ClearCache
member.summary: Clears the cache of the resolved naming conventions.
member.remarks: Note that clearing the cache will also clear all manually registered types registered via the Register method.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.ILocator.NamingConventions
member.summary:
Gets or sets the naming conventions to use to locate types.
By adding or removing conventions to this property, the service can use custom resolving of types.
Each implementation should add its own default naming convention.
member.remarks: Keep in mind that all results are cached. The cache itself is not automatically cleared when the are changed. If the are changed, the cache must be cleared manually.

member.summary: Resolves the specified value to resolve. It uses both the and the manually registered values registered via the method to resolve the value.

member.summary: Executes the specified action with the specified arguments synchronously on the thread the Dispatcher is associated with.
member.remarks: For target frameworks where the class does not contain the Invoke method, the BeginInvoke method will be used instead.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.IDispatcherService.Invoke(System.Delegate,System.Object[])
member.summary: Executes the specified delegate with the specified arguments synchronously on the thread the Dispatcher is associated with.

An array of objects to pass as arguments to the given method. Can be null.
member.remarks: For target frameworks where the class does not contain the Invoke method, the BeginInvoke method will be used instead.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.IDispatcherService.BeginInvoke(System.Action)
member.summary: Executes the specified action asynchronously with the specified arguments on the thread that the Dispatcher was created on.
member.remarks: For target frameworks where the class does not contain the Invoke method, the BeginInvoke method will be used instead.

member.summary: Executes the specified delegate asynchronously with the specified arguments on the thread that the Dispatcher was created on.
member.param: A delegate to a method that takes parameters specified in args, which is pushed onto the Dispatcher event queue.
An array of objects to pass as arguments to the given method. Can be null.
member.remarks: If there is no dispatcher available (for example, during unit tests without UI), the method will be invoked immediately.

member.summary: Shows the please wait window with the specified status text.

member.summary: Shows the please wait window with the specified status text and executes the work delegate (in a background thread). When the work is finished, the please wait window will be automatically closed.

member.summary: Updates the status text.
member.param: The status. When the string is null or empty, the default please wait text will be used.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.IPleaseWaitService.UpdateStatus(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary:
Updates the status and shows a progress bar with the specified status text. The percentage will be automatically calculated.
The busy indicator will automatically hide when the is larger than .
When providing the , it is possible to use {0} (represents current item) and {1} (represents total items).
member.param: The status format. Can be empty, but not null.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.IPleaseWaitService.Hide
member.summary: Hides this please wait window.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.IPleaseWaitService.Push(System.String)
member.summary:
Increases the number of clients that show the please wait window. The implementing class is responsible for holding a counter internally which a call to this method will increase.
As long as the internal counter is not zero (0), the please wait window will stay visible. To decrease the counter, make a call to .
A call to or one of its overloads will not increase the internal counter. A call to will reset the internal counter to zero (0) and thus hide the window.
member.param: The status to change the text to.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.IPleaseWaitService.Pop
member.summary:
Decreases the number of clients that show the please wait window. The implementing class is responsible for holding a counter internally which a call to this method will decrease.
As long as the internal counter is not zero (0), the please wait window will stay visible. To increase the counter, make a call to .
A call to or one of its overloads will not increase the internal counter. A call to will reset the internal counter to zero (0) and thus hide the window.

member.name: T:Catel.MVVM.Services.NamingConvention
member.summary: Class that is able to resolve naming conventions.

member.name: F:Catel.MVVM.Services.NamingConvention.ViewModelName
member.summary:
The view model name constant that will be replaced by the naming convention. This constant will be replaced by the view model name without the "ViewModel" prefix.
For example, the following naming convention: [AS].UI.Views.[VM]View
will result in the following view for ExampleViewModel: MyAssembly.UI.Views.ExampleView.xaml

member.name: F:Catel.MVVM.Services.NamingConvention.ViewName
member.summary:
The view name constant that will be replaced by the naming convention. This constant will be replaced by the view name without the "View", "Window" and "Control" prefix.
For example, the following naming convention: [AS].UI.Views.[VW]ViewModel
will result in the following view model for ExampleViewModel: MyAssembly.UI.Views.ExampleView.xaml

member.name: F:Catel.MVVM.Services.NamingConvention.Assembly
member.summary:
The assembly constant that will be replaced by the naming convention. This constant will be replaced by the assembly name.
For example, the following naming convention: [AS].UI.Views.[VM]View
will result in the following view for ExampleViewModel: MyAssembly.UI.Views.ExampleView.xaml

member.name: F:Catel.MVVM.Services.NamingConvention.Up
member.summary:
The assembly constant that will be replaced by the naming convention. This constant will be move up one step in the type namespace tree.
For example, the following naming convention: [UP].Views.[VM]View
will result in the following view for Catel.ViewModels.ExampleViewModel: Catel.Views.ExampleView.xaml

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.NamingConvention.ResolveViewByViewModelName(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Resolves the convention by using the view model name.
This method does not add assemblies or resolve types, but will only return a string containing the resolved value based on the convention.
The following constants can be used in this method: *
member.param: The assembly which is the base namespace.
Class name of the view model. This parameter must only contain the type name, not the full type. For example ExampleViewModel.
member.returns: The resolved convention.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.NamingConvention.ResolveViewModelByViewName(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Resolves the convention by using the view name.
This method does not add assemblies or resolve types, but will only return a string containing the resolved value based on the convention.
The following constants can be used in this method: *
member.param: The assembly which is the base namespace.
Class name of the view. This parameter must only contain the type name, not the full type. For example ExampleView.
member.returns: The resolved convention.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.NamingConvention.ResolveNamingConvention(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Resolves the naming convention.
member.param: The constants with values. The Key must be the constant as it will be used inside the convention. The Value is the value the constant must be replaced with.
member.returns: The resolved convention.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.NamingConvention.ResolveNamingConvention(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Resolves the naming convention.
member.param: The constants with values. The Key must be the constant as it will be used inside the convention. The Value is the value the constant must be replaced with.
The value you try to resolve
member.returns: The resolved convention.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.NamingConvention.GetParentPath(System.String)
member.summary:
Gets the parent path with the separator of choice. For example, the following path:
Catel.MVVM.Services
Will return the following value when using the dot (.) as separator:
Catel.MVVM
member.returns: The parent path.
member.remarks: This method automatically finds the parent separator by calling the and then calls .

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.NamingConvention.GetParentPath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Gets the parent path with the separator of choice. For example, the following path:
Catel.MVVM.Services
Will return the following value when using the dot (.) as separator:
Catel.MVVM
member.returns: The parent path.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.NamingConvention.GetParentSeparator(System.String)
member.summary:
Gets the parent separator.
This method tries to use the following separators:
Backslash (\)
Slash (/)
Dot (.)
Pipe (|)
member.returns: The separator or null if no known separator was found.

member.summary: Removes all postfixes from the specified value.

member.returns: The value without the postfixes.

Updates the status and shows a progress bar with the specified status text. The percentage will be automatically calculated.
The busy indicator will automatically hide when the is larger than .

member.summary: Hides this please wait window.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.Test.PleaseWaitService.Push(System.String)
member.summary:
Increases the number of clients that show the please wait window. The implementing class is responsible for holding a counter internally which a call to this method will increase.
As long as the internal counter is not zero (0), the please wait window will stay visible. To decrease the counter, make a call to .
A call to or one of its overloads will not increase the internal counter. A call to will reset the internal counter to zero (0) and thus hide the window.
member.param: The status to change the text to.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.Test.PleaseWaitService.Pop
member.summary:
Decreases the number of clients that show the please wait window. The implementing class is responsible for holding a counter internally which a call to this method will decrease.
As long as the internal counter is not zero (0), the please wait window will stay visible. To increase the counter, make a call to .
A call to or one of its overloads will not increase the internal counter. A call to will reset the internal counter to zero (0) and thus hide the window.

member.name: T:Catel.MVVM.UI.ViewToViewModelMappingType
member.summary: Mapping types for the .

member.name: F:Catel.MVVM.UI.ViewToViewModelMappingType.TwoWayDoNothing
member.summary:
Two way, which means that either the view or the view model will update the values of the other party as soon as they are updated.
When this value is used, nothing happens when the view model of the view changes. This way, it might be possible that the values of the view and the view model are different. The first one to update next will update the other.

member.name: F:Catel.MVVM.UI.ViewToViewModelMappingType.TwoWayViewWins
member.summary:
Two way, which means that either the view or the view model will update the values of the other party as soon as they are updated.
When this value is used, the value of the view is used when the view model of the view is changed, and is directly transferred to the view model value.

member.name: F:Catel.MVVM.UI.ViewToViewModelMappingType.TwoWayViewModelWins
member.summary:
Two way, which means that either the view or the view model will update the values of the other party as soon as they are updated.
When this value is used, the value of the view model is used when the view model of the view is changed, and is directly transferred to the view value.

member.summary: The mapping is from the view to the view model only.

Attribute to define a property available on a model property that is decorated with the as well.
[Model] [Expose("FirstName")] [Expose("MiddleName")] [Expose("LastName")] public Person Person { get ;set; }

member.summary:
Gets or sets the name of the property on the model. If the is not the same as the name of the property on the model, this can be used to map the properties.
By default, the value is the same as the .
In this example, the name of the property to map on the model is first_name, but it must be available as FirstName on the view model.
[Model] [Expose("FirstName", "first_name")] public Person Person { get; set; }

member.summary: Attribute to gather validation from a in a property, which must be of type .

[ValidationToViewModel("PersonValidationTag")] public IValidationSummary PersonValidationSummary { get; set; }

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.ValidationToViewModelAttribute.UseTagToFilter
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether this attribute should use the tag to filter the validation.
If the value is true, the validation will be filtered on the tag. Otherwise, all validation results will be returned. Keep in mind that the can still be null, even when this value is true.
The default value is true.

member.name: T:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelToModelMode
member.summary: Specifies the different mapping modes available for the .

member.name: F:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelToModelMode.TwoWay
member.summary: Automatically maps the property from view model to model and back as soon as either one changes the property value.

member.name: F:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelToModelMode.OneWay
member.summary:
Automatically maps the property from the model to the view model if the model changes the property value.
This mode does not map any values from the view model to the model, thus can also be seen as read-only mode.

member.name: F:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelToModelMode.OneWayToSource
member.summary:
Automatically maps the property from the view model to the model if the view model changes the property value.
This mode does not map any values from the model to the view model, but still keeps track of all validation that occurs in the model.

member.name: F:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelToModelMode.Explicit
member.summary: Automatically maps properties from the model to the view model as soon as the is initialized. As soon as a property value changes in the model, the view model value is updated instantly. However, the mapping from the view model to model is explicit.

member.name: T:Catel.MVVM.IViewModel
member.summary: View model interface.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.IViewModel.InitializeViewModel
member.summary:
Initializes the view model. Normally the initialization is done in the constructor, but sometimes this must be delayed to a state where the associated UI element (user control, window, ...) is actually loaded.
This method is called as soon as the associated UI element is loaded.
member.remarks:
It's not recommended to implement the initialization of properties in this method. The initialization of properties should be done in the constructor. This method should be used to start the retrieval of data from a web service or something similar.
During unit tests, it is recommended to manually call this method because there is no external container calling this method.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.IViewModel.ValidateViewModel(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelBase.InitializeViewModel
member.summary:
Initializes the view model. Normally the initialization is done in the constructor, but sometimes this must be delayed to a state where the associated UI element (user control, window, ...) is actually loaded.
This method is called as soon as the associated UI element is loaded.
member.remarks:
It's not recommended to implement the initialization of properties in this method. The initialization of properties should be done in the constructor. This method should be used to start the retrieval of data from a web service or something similar.
During unit tests, it is recommended to manually call this method because there is no external container calling this method.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelBase.OnNavigationCompleted
member.summary: Called when the navigation has completed.
member.remarks:
This should of course be a cleaner solution, but there is no other way to let a view-model know that navigation has completed. Another option is injection, but this would require every view-model for Windows Phone 7 to accept only the navigation context, which has actually nothing to do with the logic.
It is also possible to use the event.

member.summary:
Gets a value indicating whether the commands should automatically be invalidated on a property change.
If this property is false, properties should either be invalidated by the .NET Framework or by a manual call to the method.
member.value: true if the commands should automatically be invalidated on a property change; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelBase.DeferValidationUntilFirstSaveCall
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether all validation should be deferred until the first call to .
If this value is true, all validation will be suspended. As soon as the first call is made to the , the validation will no longer be suspended and activated.
The default value is false.
member.value: true if the validation should be deferred; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: If this value is used, it must be set as first property in the view model because the validation kicks in immediately when properties change.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelBase.ValidateModelsOnInitialization
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to validate the models as soon as they are initialized. This means that as soon as a model value is set, the view model checks whether the entity already contains errors.
If this value is true, the errors will immediately be returned for mappings on the model. Otherwise, the errors will only become available when a value is entered and then being undone.
The default value is true.
member.value: true if the models should be validated on initialization; otherwise, false.

member.name: E:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelBase.NavigationCompleted
member.summary: Occurs when the navigation is completed.
member.remarks:
This should of course be a cleaner solution, but there is no other way to let a view-model know that navigation has completed. Another option is injection, but this would require every view-model for Windows Phone 7 to accept only the navigation context, which has actually nothing to do with the logic.
It is also possible to use the event.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Controls.IUserControl.CloseViewModelOnUnloaded
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user control should close any existing view model when the control is unloaded from the visual tree.
Set this property to false if a view model should be kept alive and re-used for unloading/loading instead of creating a new one.
By default, this value is true.
member.value: true if the view model should be closed when the control is unloaded; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Controls.IUserControl.SupportParentViewModelContainers
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether parent view model containers are supported. If supported, the user control will search for a that implements the interface. During this search, the user control will use both the visual and logical tree.
If a user control does not have any parent control implementing the interface, searching for it is useless and requires the control to search all the way to the top for the implementation. To prevent this from happening, set this property to false.
The default value is true.
member.value: true if parent view model containers are supported; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Controls.IUserControl.DisableWhenNoViewModel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user control should automatically be disabled when there is no active view model.
member.value: true if the user control should automatically be disabled when there is no active view model; otherwise, false.

This method is public due to the face that weak events are used. Otherwise, the navigation completed events could not be handled (because we unsubscribed from the _rootFrame) when navigating away to prevent memory leaks.

member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user control should close any existing view model when the control is unloaded from the visual tree.
Set this property to false if a view model should be kept alive and re-used for unloading/loading instead of creating a new one.
By default, this value is true.
member.value: true if the view model should be closed when the control is unloaded; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Controls.MVVMProviders.Logic.UserControlLogic.SupportParentViewModelContainers
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether parent view model containers are supported. If supported, the user control will search for a that implements the interface. During this search, the user control will use both the visual and logical tree.
If a user control does not have any parent control implementing the interface, searching for it is useless and requires the control to search all the way to the top for the implementation. To prevent this from happening, set this property to false.
The default value is true.
member.value: true if parent view model containers are supported; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Catel.Windows.Controls.UserControl
member.summary: that supports MVVM by using a typed parameter. If the user control is not constructed with the right view model by the developer, it will try to create the view model itself. It does this by keeping an eye on the DataContext property. If the property changes, the control will check the type of the DataContext and try to create the view model by using the DataContext value as the constructor. If the view model can be constructed, the DataContext of the UserControl will be replaced by the view model.
member.remarks:
This control can resolve a view model in the following ways:
By using the method.
By using the which is registered in the .
This control suffers a lot from the bugs, or features "by design" as Microsoft likes to call it, of WPF. Below are the most common issues that this control suffers from:
WPF sometimes invokes the Loaded multiple times, without invoking Unloaded.
member.exception: The view model of the view could not be resolved. Use either the method or .

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Controls.UserControl.CloseViewModelOnUnloaded
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user control should close any existing view model when the control is unloaded from the visual tree.
Set this property to false if a view model should be kept alive and re-used for unloading/loading instead of creating a new one.
By default, this value is true.
member.value: true if the view model should be closed when the control is unloaded; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Controls.UserControl.SupportParentViewModelContainers
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether parent view model containers are supported. If supported, the user control will search for a that implements the interface. During this search, the user control will use both the visual and logical tree.
If a user control does not have any parent control implementing the interface, searching for it is useless and requires the control to search all the way to the top for the implementation. To prevent this from happening, set this property to false.
The default value is true.
member.value: true if parent view model containers are supported; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Controls.UserControl.DisableWhenNoViewModel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user control should automatically be disabled when there is no active view model.
member.value: true if the user control should automatically be disabled when there is no active view model; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Catel.Windows.Controls.UserControl`1
member.summary: that supports MVVM by using a typed parameter. If the user control is not constructed with the right view model by the developer, it will try to create the view model itself. It does this by keeping an eye on the DataContext property. If the property changes, the control will check the type of the DataContext and try to create the view model by using the DataContext value as the constructor. If the view model can be constructed, the DataContext of the UserControl will be replaced by the view model.
member.typeparam: The type of the view model.
member.remarks: Starting with Catel 3.0, the now derives from and should only be used when there is an actual need to specify the class as a generic. Otherwise, it is always recommend to use the new which is not generic and can determine the view model by itself.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Interactivity.DelayBindingUpdate.UpdateDelay
member.summary:
Gets or sets the update delay.
This is the value that is used between updates in milliseconds. The binding will be updated after the delay. When a new value becomes available, the timer is reset and starts all over.
The default value is 100. If the value is smaller than 50, the value will be ignored and there will be no delay between the value change and binding update. If the value is higher than 5000, it will be set to 5000.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Interactivity.DelayBindingUpdate.PropertyName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the property.
member.remarks: This property does not reflect to any changes, so this property must be set when the is loaded.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Interactivity.DelayBindingUpdate.DependencyPropertyName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the dependency property. This property is used before the . By default, this behavior tries to retrieve the dependency property via "[PropertyName]Property" (which is the default naming convention of dependency properties). In the rare case that this naming convention is not followed, it is possible to use this property.
member.remarks:
This property does not reflect to any changes, so this property must be set when the is loaded.
This property should only be used as backup if the property does not work.

member.value: The name of the used property or null if no property is used.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Interactivity.EventToCommand.PreventInvocationIfAssociatedObjectIsDisabled
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the invocation of the command should be prevented when the is disabled.
By default, this value is true.
This property is introduced to disable the default behavior. For example, when showing a window which will disable the underlying object, the command will no longer be invoked. While this is the recommended behavior in most cases, sometimes you just need to bypass the default functionality.
member.value: true if the invocation of the command should be prevented when the is disabled; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Behavior to set focus to a . This behavior sets the focus only once on the first time the is loaded.
member.remarks: In Silverlight, focusing a control seems very, very hard. Just calling Focus() isn't enough, so a timer is used to set the timer 500 milliseconds after the user control has been loaded. This is customizable via the property.

member.name: P:Catel.Windows.Interactivity.UpdateBindingOnTextChanged.UpdateDelay
member.summary:
Gets or sets the update delay.
This is the value that is used between updates in milliseconds. The binding will be updated when no new text change event is detected within the delay.
The default value is 250. If the value is smaller than 50, the value will be ignored and there will be no delay between the key down and the binding update. If the value is higher than 5000, it will be set to 5000.

member.name: T:Catel.MVVM.Services.CameraServiceBase
member.summary:
Base implementation of the . This implementation takes care of some protection code to prevent double initialization or forgotten initialization.
This class ensures that the service is running when setting or getting cricical properties or calling critical methods. This might look a bit dumb in the first place, but saves the developer of the end-classes lots of redundant checking.

member.name: T:Catel.MVVM.Services.PleaseWaitService
member.summary:
Windows phone 7 implementation of the please wait service.
By default, the . However, it is wise to create a custom implementation and use the PerformanceProgressBar that can be found in the Windows Phone 7 toolkit.
To create a custom implementation, create a new class based on this class and override only the method.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.PleaseWaitService.Show(System.String)
member.summary: Shows the please wait window with the specified status text.
member.param: The status. When the string is null or empty, the default please wait text will be used.
member.remarks: When this method is used, the method must be called to hide the window again.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.PleaseWaitService.Show(Catel.MVVM.Services.PleaseWaitWorkDelegate,System.String)
member.summary: Shows the please wait window with the specified status text and executes the work delegate (in a background thread). When the work is finished, the please wait window will be automatically closed.
member.param: The status. When the string is null or empty, the default please wait text will be used.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.PleaseWaitService.UpdateStatus(System.String)
member.summary: Updates the status text.
member.param: The status. When the string is null or empty, the default please wait text will be used.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.PleaseWaitService.UpdateStatus(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary:
Updates the status and shows a progress bar with the specified status text. The percentage will be automatically calculated.
The busy indicator will automatically hide when the is larger than .
When providing the , it is possible to use {0} (represents current item) and {1} (represents total items).
member.param: The status format. Can be empty, but not null.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.PleaseWaitService.Hide
member.summary: Hides this please wait window.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.PleaseWaitService.Push(System.String)
member.summary:
Increases the number of clients that show the please wait window. The implementing class is responsible for holding a counter internally which a call to this method will increase.
As long as the internal counter is not zero (0), the please wait window will stay visible. To decrease the counter, make a call to .
A call to or one of its overloads will not increase the internal counter. A call to will reset the internal counter to zero (0) and thus hide the window.
member.param: The status to change the text to.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.PleaseWaitService.Pop
member.summary:
Decreases the number of clients that show the please wait window. The implementing class is responsible for holding a counter internally which a call to this method will decrease.
As long as the internal counter is not zero (0), the please wait window will stay visible. To increase the counter, make a call to .
A call to or one of its overloads will not increase the internal counter. A call to will reset the internal counter to zero (0) and thus hide the window.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.PleaseWaitService.ShowBusyIndicator
member.summary: Shows the busy indicator with the specified mode.
